title: British couple both drown in Portugal after man tried to save struggling woman
text:

A British couple in their 30s have drowned at a beach on Portugal’s south-west coast.

Local media reports that the man rushed in to the water to try and save his partner after she got into difficulty.

Nearby surfers went to their aid after seeing they were in difficulties and tried to revive them on the sand as expert help arrived but they had already gone into cardiac arrest.

They were pronounced dead at the scene.

The tragedy happened around 2.30pm local time today at a beach in Zambujeira do Mar in Portugal’s Alentejo region.

(Image: Correio da Manha)

Maritime Police chief Rui Pedro Silva Filipe said: “I can confirm they are both British citizens.

"The man was 34 and the woman was 33.

"I cannot confirm 100 per cent but I believe they were in Portugal on holiday with a group of friends.

"I don’t know at this stage if the friends were on the beach or not.

"It appears the man went to the woman’s aid when he saw she was in difficulties and was holding onto a rock.

(Image: Correio da Manha)

"He reached her but it was when they were coming back to the beach that they started drowning, maybe because they were tired.

"The local surfers went to their aid and got them out of the water to a small area of sand near the main beach but by that time they had already gone into cardiac arrest.

"Medical responders had already reached the scene and made an unsuccessful attempt to revive them by practicing CPR.

"They were taken to a local health centre where they were pronounced dead and their bodies have now been taken to Beja where autopsies will take place probably tomorrow."

The man is reported to have been aged 34 and the woman 33.

Respected Portuguese daily Correio da Manha said the man rushed into the water to save the woman.

(Image: Correio da Manha)

The surfers pulled them out of the water and made an unsuccessful attempt to save their lives.

Mr Silva Filipe described the sea at the time of the drama as “a little bit rough.”

A Portuguese Air Force helicopter took their bodies to a hospital morgue in the nearby city of Beja.

Neither has yet been named.
description: The man is reported to have rushed into the water to try and save the woman  at a beach in Zambujeira do Mar in Portugal’s Alentejo region
